program.title: Activity Classification with CreateML using AirPod Pro
program.abstract: With the new AirPods Pro Motion API opens this year we can start collecting Core Motion data from AirPod Pro. Using the Core Motion data collected I am going to show how to create a model using CreateML to classify head motion e.g. shaking your head, nodding, or even exercise like a squad. I want to get everybody excited about AI.

speakers.name: Ethan Fan
speakers.bio: Cofounder of Vimo Labs. Our app Gymatic is the only Apple Watch app that Auto recognizes any gesture and Deep analysis for fitness and sports movements. SleepMatic till today is still one of the top paid health app in the US that track you sleep using Apple Watch. FowardSwift Speaker 2017.

program.title: Navigating the Job Search in Silicon Valley
program.abstract: The talk will go through the different stages of securing a job in Silicon Valley. Starting from the beginning, weâ€™ll go over a brief overview of helpful resources, and end on the concepts of negotiating and accepting an offer. There will be statistics and data shared based on my own (as well as friendsâ€™) interview experiences. While there is much to be said for technical skills, the talk will primarily be focused on topics beyond your technical ability.

speakers.name: Stephanie
speakers.bio: Hi! My name is Stephanie and Iâ€™ve been working in San Francisco since 2014. I took a year off last year to come to Taiwan and have recently restarted my job search and signed on with a company in SF once again. I donâ€™t have a traditional background in computer science; I attended a coding bootcamp in 2015, learning Ruby on Rails. Through a lot of luck and good timing, I got the opportunity to switch over into iOS development, and Iâ€™ve been writing in Swift and Obj-C ever since
